title: How is executive education changing? - Quora

response.answer_text: Executive education has been in practice for quite some time, but there was always this challenge on how to pursue the studies on par with working full-time. Most of us pursue executive education as we consider education as a lifelong learning process considering the challenges faced in this day and age at a faster pace. We need to be on track and be able to adapt quickly to the changes happening in the corporate industry. The COVID-19 lockdown / stay at home / work from home has luckily enhanced studies in an efficient manner. It has given us the privilege to work on a greater scale whilst studying at a steady pace. Most institutes have adapted to online learning, and speaking of its advantages, there has been a clear and steady learning environment provided you choose the right institute that understands to deliver the requirements on the right time. For instance, London Institute of Business & Technology offers a wide range of pathway programmes leading to Bachelors and Masters degrees.

Everywhere we look, we can see disruption. Established business models collapse under the Covid19. Not surprisingly, executive education is also changing, and the challenge is clear: How can we achieve ever-deeper learning without ignoring executives’ need for speed and immediacy? How can we deliver executive education in such short time slots when content is also changing constantly? How Executive Education Is Changing
